main event: On August 18, 1957, a military ground-radar observation in Bedford and Canton, Ohio reported a small white object, the size of a pinhead, traveling at a high rate of speed and very high altitude for 30 seconds with no sound.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a pinhead, white in color, and made no sound.
The observation was made by a military source using ground-radar.
The report indicates a very high rate of speed and altitude for the object.
The conclusion was that there was insufficient information to properly evaluate the sighting.
The observer was 1st Lieutenant William M. Schreher, an experienced intelligence officer.
sighted object: small white object, size of a pinhead
